meanings.definition: Feeling strained as a result of having demands persistently made on one; harassed.
meanings.sent1: The harried student struggled to keep up with all the assignments.
meanings.sent2: The harried mother rushed to finish her work while taking care of her children.
meanings.sent3: The harried squirrel tried to gather nuts while dodging playful birds.
meanings.sent4: The harried bee buzzed around the garden, collecting nectar in a frenzy.
meanings.sent5: The harried firefighter raced against time to save the trapped cat from the burning building.

meanings.sent1: The persistent bully would harry the smaller kids during recess.
meanings.sent2: The aggressive salesperson would harry customers into buying unnecessary products.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten would harry the dog by pouncing on its tail.
meanings.sent4: The storm would harry the coastline, causing erosion and damage.
meanings.sent5: The paparazzi would harry the celebrity wherever she went, trying to get a photo.

meanings.definition: To make repeated attacks on (an enemy).
meanings.sent1: The army would harry the enemy troops with continuous raids.
meanings.sent2: The wolves would harry the herd of deer, looking for a weak target.
meanings.sent3: The pirates would harry the merchant ships along the coast, seeking treasure.
meanings.sent4: The rival gang would harry their competitors' territory, causing chaos.
meanings.sent5: The storm would harry the small island, battering it with strong winds and rain.
